message.content: Yes, the authors mention the estimated hourly wage paid to participants and the total amount spent on participant compensation. They used Amazon Mechanical Turk (AMT) for crowdsourcing answers to the test set and for evaluating the quality of predictions from GPT-3 (CoT) and UnifiedQA (CoT). They provided the workers with $0.5 per HIT task for the human performance study, and at the rate of 3 questions per minute, this amounts to $6.0 per hour. For human evaluation of generated explanations, they provided the workers with a monetary compensation of $0.3 for each batch of 10 explanations.

Yes, the authors include the estimated hourly wage paid to participants and the total amount spent on participant compensation. They used Amazon Mechanical Turk (AMT) for crowdsourcing human performance studies and paid $0.5 per HIT task for 15 questions at a rate of 3 questions per minute, which amounts to $6.0 per hour. They also paid $0.3 per batch for evaluating generated explanations, with 10 explanations in each batch.

Yes, the authors provided the estimated hourly wage and total amount spent on participant compensation. For the human performance study, they provided $0.5 per HIT task, which amounts to $6.0 per hour. For the human evaluation of generated explanations, they compensated the workers with $0.3 per batch.
